reviews.review_msg: DEFINITELY take a class with Dany!! This is by far my favourite class I've taken at Sfu. Her classes are heavily based on group discussions of readings and group work, so if you don't like speaking out in class don't take this class. I loved her because she really wanted her students to do well

Dany is really enthusiastic about social control and really wants all of the students to participate and get involved. Her exams are very open ended; she wants you to do well and not have much stress, however, she's a hard marker!

All depends on what your research interests are. If you're into post-structuralism, post-modernism, and so on, this is where you belong. If you're interested in the workers' movement, working class issues, and so called Marxist theory, your experience will not be a very good one. Comfortable and stimulating, but theoretically, well, not so much.

Had a conversation yesterday with another student and realized I should really write this on here. Dany is the best prof you will ever have. She is incredibly intelligent, wants her students to do well and get the most out of the course that is possible. She covers theory (especially Foucault) in a way that you'll be able to recite it years later!

Dany is one of the best profs in the department and really wants her students to succeed, which I can't emphasize enough. I liked the way the class was structured and I particularly enjoyed reading about Marx, Durkheim, and Foucault. Dany knows the material so well by now that she can freestyle the entire lecture in an engaging manner.

Dr. Lacombe is very knowledgeable about sociology. In this class we discussed many of the important topics in sociology although we did not read any Weber and I think some of the thinkers we studied have highly debatable views. However, only one side of the debate is ever offered, which is dissapointing. She is passionate about Michel Fouccault.

Dany is a really great prof! She is very passionate about sociology and she makes the theory to life. Would definitely recommend her and hopefully I can get her for SA304. The tough is pretty tough overall, keep up with the readings and the key themes!

Very interesting class. Dany really brings the material to life and makes it very relevant to your personal existence. The readings are tough and you must do the, and I recommend going to class. Midterm was hard, hard marker and expects a lot. Class discussions were very interesting,I would recommend Dany!

She's a great lecturer, but she has no notes printed up. You have to go to every class or you fall behind. She's a tough marker and gets frustrated when people don't read the material (CCW: Foucault, Marx, etc). She's funny and extremely passionate about sociological theory; focussing very much on power dynamics and gender.
passionate teacher... very interesting course!! nice explanation on the course materials! need to pay attention to the themes and concepts of the text in class. she is very helpful too

Dany makes class very interesting to attend. Blunt when appropriate and lectures are always a pleasure. Will accommodate students to breaks when she feels the need. Very passionate about subject, even the tough theories are made easy to understand. Midterm was tough so she adjusted marks and made final easier. Few assignments, but reading A MUST!

If you're a third or fourth year student, this class will be a breeze - all theories have been taught in various social sciences.  2 quizes and one term paper make up 90% of the grade.  Dany was nice, but you really have to pay attention in class for themes - if you miss just one, your grade might be in jeopardy

Dany is not only an excellent teacher, but in the "right" way.The "deeper" learning occurs with a student being led to discovery instead of just telling. The material was difficult because it was jam packed with new ideas. Very different from what we're used to. IF YOU DO NOT LIKE READING OR WANT AN EASY COURSE DONT TAKE THIS.

Excellent prof. She makes going to class a delightful experience. Very engaging and delivers potentially boring material very effectively and makes complex theories interesting and accessible. Gives very detailed comments and is very passionate about her profession. Highly recommended course! Changes the way you think about society!
No Comments
No Comments

really really good class and Dany is really enthusiastic and she is an amazing teacher. The subject matter is also really interesting. Dany is also really open to discussion and I found that she really wanted us to do well on our tests, she asked us before hand how we wanted the test to be formatted
I really liked Dany's lectures, juicy material and a lot of information packed in there. Introduced me to many new concepts and theories. Would have liked less focus on group work, though

it was an interesting course, but lacombe has tricky multiple choice questions that screw you over, you get the impression she WANTS you to do bad. she is not very friendly during office hours and unresponsive to concerns and questions over email.
A feminist in every sense of the word. She articulates her points very well and is a great lecturer.
